Key Arguments: The legislation threatens the open marketplace of ideas and could lead to hegemonic ideologies controlled by the government.
The bill may impede on Australians' human rights, particularly freedom of speech and expression.
The Australian Human Rights Commission has a duty to advise against the bill as it breaches human rights.
The legislation could lead to manipulation, control, and authoritarian censorship.
Free speech cannot be balanced; it is either free or it isn't.
Notable Quotes: It is absolutely way over the top to put it mildly, it is onerous; it breaches the human rights of Australians.
It would signal essentially the end of the free marketplace of ideas online.
There is no such thing as a balance of free speech. Speech is either free or it isnâ€™t.
